intro: Swainsona similis, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a fuzzy texture, while its stems are woody and branching. Swainsona similis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
